description.narrative: IN SWEDISH Programmets övergripande syfte är att bidra till klimat-resilienta landskap och förbättrad försörjning (med producent-organisationer inom lantbruk/jord-/skogsbruk som betydande förändringsaktörer), med fyra huvudmålsättningar: 1. Mer inkluderande styre och förvaltning samt tvärsektoriella processer leder till anpassade policies och ramverk (SDG 16 & 17), 2. Ökat företagande, tillgång till marknader och finansiering genom rättvisa värdekedjor och tjänster för affärsutveckling inom lantbruks- och producentorganisationer (SDG 1, 5, 8 & 12), 3. Lantbruks- och producentorganisationer bidrar till utsläppsminskning, klimatanpassning och resiliens på landskapsnivå med hållbara försörjningsmöjligheter (SDG 2,3 &15), 4. Förbättrad och jämlik tillgång till sociala och kulturella tjänster (SDG 3&10) Begreppet "lantbruks- och producentorganisationer" används här i första hand med tanke på det småskaliga lantbruket, och definieras enligt projektdokumentet: - Lantbrukare (forest and farm producers) är kvinnor och män, småbrukarfamiljer, urfolk och lokalsamhällen som har en stark relation till skogs- och jordbruk (forests and farms) i skogliga landskap. - Lantbruks- och producentorganisationer (Forest-and-farm producer organisations, FFPO) är formella och informella intresseföreningar av de producenter som beskrivs ovan. Organisationerna är skapade för att underlätta medlemmarnas utbyte av kunskap och erfarenhet, politisk påverkan, säkrande av mark- och naturresursrättigheter, tillgång till marknader, företagande, dvs öka inkomster och välfärd. De varierar i form, storlek, inriktning, t ex sammanslutningar av urfolk, medlemmar i en by, trädjordbrukare, skogsägare, kooperativ, företag och deras paraplyorganisationer. IN ENGLISH The overall objective is to contribute to Climate resilient landscapes and improved livelihoods through four outcomes: 1. More inclusive governance and cross-sectorial processes lead to enabling policies (SDG 16 &17); 2. Increased entrepreneurship, access to markets and finance through equitable value chain and business development services within FFPOs (SDG 1, 5, 8 & 12). 3. Improved delivery of landscape scale mitigation, adaptation and resilience to climate change through direct engagement of FFPOs and integration with inclusive livelihood approaches (SDG 2, 13, &15) 4. Improved and equitable access to social and cultural services (SDG 3 & 10). The focus of the Forest and Farm Facility is on small-scale forest- and farm producers and their organisations. The following definitions are provided by the project document: Forest-and-farm producers are women and men, smallholder families, indigenous peoples and local communities who have strong relationships with forests and farms in forested landscapes. Such producers grow, manage, harvest and process a wide range of natural-resource-based goods and services for subsistence use and for sale in local, national or international markets. Forest-and-farm producer organizations (FFPOs) are formal or informal associations of such producers. They are created with the aim of helping their members share knowledge and experience; engage in policy advocacy; secure tenure and access rights to forest, land and other natural resources; improve forest-and-farm management; expand markets; build enterprises; and increase income and well-being. FFPOs vary widely in size and institutional form and may focus on forests or combinations of forest- and farm-related activities. They may include indigenous peoples and local community organizations; tree-grower and agroforestry associations; forest owner associations; producer cooperatives and companies; and their umbrella groups and federations.

Omprogrammerade medel för att bekämpa covid-19 Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 The Forest & Farm Facility (FFF) är en mekanism för finansiering och kapacitetsbyggande med syfte att stärka producentorganisationer i deras arbete för ekonomisk, miljömässig och social utveckling, samt främja deras deltagande i skogs- o lantbruksrelaterad politisk dialog o samråd. Den verkar initialt i 7 länder i Latinamerika, Asien och Afrika, men kan expandera när ytterligare finansiering kommer in. Programmet genomförs av fyra organisationer i samarbete, FAO, IIED ,IUCN och Agricord. FFF är en utveckling av FAOs tidigare initiativ för utveckling av lokalt skogsbruk, men mer inriktad på att främja bondeorganisationers och deras medlemmars tillgång till marknad och beslutsfora, samt klimatanpassning och jämställdhet.

Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19 Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 The Forest & Farm Facility (FFF) is a mechanism for financing and capacity building with the purpose of strengthening producer organizations in their work for economic, environmental and social development, as well as promoting their participation in forest and agriculture related policy dialogue and consultation. It will establish initially in 7 countries in Latin America, Asia and Africa, but may expand when additional funding comes in. The program is implemented by four organizations in cooperation, FAO, IIED, IUCN and Agricord. FFF is a development of the FAO's previous initiative for development of local forestry, but is more focused on giving farmers associations and their members better access to markets and decision making fora, as well as a focus on gender and climate adaptation.

tag.narrative: 1.4 - By 2030, ensure that all men and women, in particular the poor and the vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to basic services, ownership and control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources, appropriate new technology and financial services, including microfinance.

1.4 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla män och kvinnor, i synnerhet de fattiga och de utsatta, har lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, tillgång till grundläggande tjänster, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till arv, naturresurser, lämplig ny teknik och finansiella tjänster, inklusive mikrokrediter.
13.1 - Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries.
13.1 - Stärka motståndskraften mot och förmågan till anpassning till klimatrelaterade faror och naturkatastrofer i alla länder.

15.2 - By 2020, promote the implementation of sustainable management of all types of forests, halt deforestation, restore degraded forests and substantially increase afforestation and reforestation globally.

15.2 - Till 2020 främja genomförandet av hållbart brukande av alla typer av skogar, stoppa avskogningen, återställa utarmade skogar och kraftigt öka nybeskogningen och återbeskogningen i hela världen.

title.narrative: Contribution agreement between Sida and FAO, Support to Forest and Farm Facility
Beslut om insats, Forest and Farm Faclity

description.narrative:
The FFFs overall goal is to help generate climate resilient landscapes and improved livelihoods. The program divides their work and achieved results according to four outcome areas:
1. More enabling policy and legal frameworks for forest and farm organizations, 2. Increased entrepreneurship, access to markets and finance through gender equitable value chains, 3. Improved delivery of landscape-scale mitigation of and adaptation to climate change and climate resilience through direct engagement of forest and farm organizations and 4. Improved and equitable access to social and cultural services.
Some examples of results achieved under each area are:
Outcome area 1: The program significantly increased the number of changes in policies, processes or decisions in favor of FFPOs, reflecting the assistance provided to FFPOs in developing advocacy agendas. 58 direct changes in policies, processes or decisions in favour of forest and farm organizations (up from 13 in 2019). 128 strengthened or new policy processes (up from 50 in 2019) through more active participation of forest and farm organizations. On country level, in Bolivia, the National Indigenous Forestry Association (AFIN) made significant progress towards designing a national legal standard for financing forestry enterprises together with the Government of Bolivia. In Ghana, the FFF has been supporting GhaFFaP to organize quarterly grassroots and zonal round tables linking to bi-annual National Dialogue series that target high-level decision makers in government, private sector and civil society organizations. These meetings allowed GhaFFaP members to draft and validate 11 advocacy agendas.
Outcome area 2: 162 forest and farm businesses supported (up from 128 in 2019), of which 40 percent are run by women. 58 have business plans with credible financial information (up from 11 in 2019). 30 apex-level forest and farm organizations have led business needs assessments that inform business incubation efforts. On country level, in Ecuador, UNORCAC piloted the establishment of a new working capital fund as an innovative way of accessing finance. Lack of access to working capital has been a barrier for a group of female entrepreneurs to develop their business selling traditional Andean products in the local markets. Outcome area 3: 70 019 hectares of forested landscapes restored. 27 partnerships with climate and landscape restoration programmes formed at the national and sub national levels (up from 15 in 2019). 99 forest and farm organizations have developed climate resilient plans and practices (up from 11 in 2019). On country level, in Zambia, CAZ has, with FFF support, mainstreamed agroforestry and climate smart agriculture in its operational programmes. Ninety-five farmers (including 41 women) were trained in agroforestry in the cotton farms. Ten study circle groups started practicing agroforestry and some groups allocated areas for conservation.
Outcome area 4: Many, if not most, of the organizations that FFF works with are involved with issues related to social protection, health, education, infrastructure and culture. 43 forest and farm organizations provided services to many more than 6 646 producers (up from 11 in 2019), much of this linked to COVID-19 related services. 49 forest and farm organizations have formal outreach and communication plans (up from 4 in 2019). These types of activities were especially important in 2020, when practically all the groups were involved in COVID-19 related health and social protection efforts. However, there is need to clarify the program's approach to this, as there have been a lack of clarity. only 10N of the allocated budget goes to this outcome area. On country level, in Nepal FECOFUN collaborated with local government authorities to develop a COVID-19 response plan, contributing resources from its CFUG social development fund to distribute masks, soap, sanitzsers and essential food stuffs to its members. COVID-19 has so far greatly impacted the markets and services that many of the FFPOs are dependent on. Well-organized producers and communities were seen to fare better than the others. They were mainly better able to find new markets, but practically all the organizations surveyed worked to raise awareness on the pandemic and many distributed personal protective equipment or other needed goods. This highlighted once again the central role of local organizations in addressing rural challenges, whether they be climate change, job creation, food insecurity, or contagious diseases. The fact that the programme concentrates so much on local organizations and the producers and communities, who never left their villages and continued throughout, proved to be a major advantage.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
